value.title: Why ShotSpotter Stock Soared 30% in February While the Market Plunged
value.excerpt: The market's sell-off was driven by concerns that the spread of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, could curb global economic growth. value.title: Coronavirus stock plunge nears $4 trillion, spoiling bull market's 11th birthday
value.excerpt: The coronavirus stock market plunge could spoil a major party for Wall Street: The bull market's 11th birthday. Monday, March 9, would the 11-year anniversary of the end of the market's financial crisis meltdown. Stocks began rising in March 2009 — well before the economy had turned around — and have been climbing steadily since.
